dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: Finally.  What took you so long to answer?  We're pressed for time, if you could tell by the rumbling.

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: I'm sorry.  I need a minute every time I get off ice.  The nausea spells are evil to me.

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: Right, that's- that's fine.  I'm sorry for yelling.  I'm just stressed right now.  Are you feeling any better?

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: I'll manage.  What's the damage?

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: We just passed through an asteroid belt.  Whatever was in it was highly acidic, and the ship ingested a lot.

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: We're dealing with major structural imbalance, overheating engines, and-

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: So the ship has indigestion?

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: More precisely, cosmic gastroesophageal reflux… C-GERD.

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: Oh!  That doesn't sound so bad.  It could be worse.  Like that one time we had to excavate tonsil stones.  Remember the smell?

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: I tend to forget things I don't like.

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: Do we have any Bepto-Pismaul left?  We can administer it through the digestive pipes and let the ship ride out the heartburn.

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: Stocks are good, but our switchboard is offline.  Rebooting will take more time than we have.

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: Let's manually route the Galaxy-Bismol.  We're on opposite ends of the ship, so we'll need to connect with a stable link.

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: I'm right on it.  Oh, and one more thing, Mac.

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: Hm?

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: It's been a few decades since we spoke.  We're still flying through space, huh… I hope next time, it'll be when we land.

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: Ah...

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: Me, too, Astrid.  The moons are beautiful where I am.  I hope you can see them.

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: The dosage wasn’t enough.  The acid is burning our infrastructure!

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: We need to route more Galaxy-Bismol.  Crap, the system’s all jumbled again.  Astrid, you’re still with me?

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: I’m here.  There’s a cap on the medicine.  We’ll need to bypass a few safeguards before administering more.

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: Let's do it.

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: Engines are stabilizing.  Power is returning to core facets of the ship.

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: It's not over yet.  One more dose and we should be clear.

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: Hey, at least I get to spend more time with you.

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: Ha!  I was going to say the same thing.

dialogue.speaker: Mac
dialogue.text: Oh, well, this is nice, then.  You look really pretty tonight, I forgot to add.

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: It’s been a whole day?  What time is it?  I swore we started at 08:00 system time.

dialogue.speaker: Astrid
dialogue.text: Wait, did you say I looked pretty?
